str2: Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.
Hence, from this place, on this side and on that. From the same as enthade; hence; on both sides.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
